bibl.title: Letter from Alton P. Tisdel to Philip Showalter Hench, February 25, 1941

div1.p: Tisdel provides a list of government publications that are available and those which are out-of-print.

div1.head: Letter from Alton P. Tisdel to Philip Showalter Hench, February 25, 1941
div1.opener:
GRG
UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT PRINTING OFFICE
DIVISION OF PUBLIC DOCUMENTS
WASHINGTON, D. C.
February 25, 1941.
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Your letter of February 24th is returned herewith,
via air mail special delivery, with the information that
the only publications we can supply are as follows:
Annual Reports of the War Department:
1899, Vol. 1, Part 2 .......$0.75
1900, Vol. 1, Part 10 ...... 0.30
1902, Vol. 8 ............... 0.20

The others have become exhausted from stock and out
of print. It is possible you may be able to procure copies
from either of the following second-hand book dealers here
in Washington, D.C.:
Luther M. Cornwall, 723 - 11th St., N.W.
W. H. Lowdermilk, 1418 F Street, N.W.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, ALTON P. TISDEL,
Superintendent of Documents. Enc.
